    • Uses of AttackEvent in GTTM_Analyser

      Methods in GTTM_Analyser with parameters of type AttackEvent 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double ProlongationalReductionAnalyser.assessBranchingStability(AttackEvent parentEvent, AttackEvent sub, boolean isRightBranching)
      Provides a rating as to how stable a branch a given AttackEvent forms with a given parent AttackEvent.
      double TimeSpanReductionAnalyser.assessConsonance(AttackEvent parent, AttackEvent child)
      Assesses the consonance between two given AttackEvents objects.
      double ProlongationalReductionAnalyser.assessHarmonicRelationA(AttackEvent parentEvent, AttackEvent childEvent)
      Assesses the harmonic stability of a given child AttackEvent in relation to the given parent AttackEvent according to the rule that 'a connection between two events is harmonically more stable if their roots are closer on the circle of fifths'.
      double ProlongationalReductionAnalyser.assessHarmonicRelationB(AttackEvent parentEvent, AttackEvent childEvent, boolean rightBranching)
      Assesses the harmonic stability of a given child AttackEvent in relation to the given parent AttackEvent according to the rule that 'a progression that ascends along the circle of fifths is most stable as a right-branching structure; one that descends along the circle of fifths is more stable as a left branching structure'.
      double ProlongationalReductionAnalyser.assessMelodicStabilityA(AttackEvent parent, AttackEvent sub)
      Assesses the melodic stability of a given sub pitch with a given parent pitch.
      double ProlongationalReductionAnalyser.assessMelodicStabilityB(AttackEvent parent, AttackEvent sub, boolean isRightBranching)
      Assesses the melodic stability of a given subBranch beat with a given parentBranch beat.
      double MetricalStructureAnalyser.assessMPR5(java.util.List<Event> events, AttackEvent event, java.util.Map<Beat,Event> beatMap, int level, TimeSpanReductionBranch topTBranch)
      Provides a rating based on application of the MPR5 rule.
      double MetricalStructureAnalyser.assessMPR5a(java.util.List<Event> events, AttackEvent event)
      Provides a rating that describes how well the AttackEvent event ranks as a candidate for landing on a strong beat based on the mean length of events in the list events.
      double MetricalStructureAnalyser.assessMPR5b(java.util.List<Event> events, AttackEvent event)
      Assesses a given AttackEvent against a context of Events to assess whether the given AttackEvent constitutes a candidate for a strong beat.
      double MetricalStructureAnalyser.assessMPR5c(java.util.List<Event> events, AttackEvent event)
      Assesses how likely a given AttackEvent will land on a strong beat in the metrical structure given the context of Event objects.
      double MetricalStructureAnalyser.assessMPR5d(java.util.List<Event> events, AttackEvent event)
      Assesses how likely a given AttackEvent will land on a strong beat in the metrical structure given the context of Event objects.
      double MetricalStructureAnalyser.assessMPR5e(TimeSpanReductionBranch topBranch, java.util.Map<Beat,Event> beatMap, int level, AttackEvent ev)
      Assesses how likely a given AttackEvent will land on a strong beat in the metrical structure given the context of Event objects.
      double ProlongationalReductionAnalyser.assessPitchStability(AttackEvent subBranch, Scale localScale)
      Assesses the diatonic stability of a given subBranch beat with a given parentBranch beat.
      ProlongationalTypeEnum ProlongationalReductionAnalyser.assessProlongationalType(AttackEvent parent, AttackEvent child)
      Provides an analysis of two AttackEvents to see what kind of prolongational branching type the second AttackEvent constitutes in relation to the first event.
      double ProlongationalReductionAnalyser.assessPRPR3(AttackEvent parent, AttackEvent child, boolean rightBranching, boolean progression, Scale localScale)
      Provides an assessment of the stability of a given ProlongationalBranch in relation to a given parent.
      double ProlongationalReductionAnalyser.assessPRPR3(Beat parentBranch, Beat subBranch, AttackEvent parent, AttackEvent child, Scale localScale, boolean progression)
      Provides an assessment of the stability of a given ProlongationalBranch in relation to a given parent.
      double TimeSpanReductionAnalyser.assessTonicRelation(AttackEvent child, Scale localScale)
      Assesses the strength of the relation of a given AttackEvent to the local tonic.
      double TimeSpanReductionAnalyser.assessTonicRelationBetweenEvents(AttackEvent parent, AttackEvent child, Scale localTonic)
      Assesses whether the proposed parent AttackEvent has a higher relation to the given Scale's tonic than the proposed child AttackEvent.
      double TimeSpanReductionAnalyser.assessTSPR2(AttackEvent parent, AttackEvent child, Scale localScale)
      Assesses how preferable the proposed child AttackEvent would constitute a child branch of the branch associated with the proposed parent AttackEvent.
      double TimeSpanReductionAnalyser.assessTSPR3a(AttackEvent parent, AttackEvent child)
      Assesses how preferable a proposed parent AttackEvent constitutes the parent branch of a given child AttackEvent by assessing how strongly the given parent event constitutes a higher melodic pitch than the given child event.
      double TimeSpanReductionAnalyser.getTSPR2andTSPR3(AttackEvent parent, AttackEvent child, Scale localScale)
      Generates a rating based on the combination of TSPR2 and TSPR3 rules, reflecting the weightings of the different rules.
